Managed Disks

Persistent, secured disk storage for Azure virtual machines

Apply for trial Buy Now

Azure Managed Disk is a new and recommended disk storage product used for Azure Virtual Machines, enabling permanent data storage. Multiple Managed Disks can be used for every virtual machine. Managed Disks provide two types of lasting storage options: premium Managed Disk and standard Managed Disk.

If you’re interested in the pricing details of Non-Managed Disk, please refer to the Non-Managed Disk and Page Blob pricing details page.

Premium Managed Disk

Premium Managed Disk, based on high-performance solid state drive (SSD), aims to support I/O intensive workloads, with extremely high throughput and low delay. With the help of Premium Managed Disk, we can set a permanent disk and configure its size and performance characteristics.

The total expenses of Premium Managed Disk depends on the disk size and quantity, and is subjected to the outgoing data transmission. The disk size provides different input/output operations per second (IOP), throughput limits and monthly pricing per GB. We can select most appropriate options including storage size, IOP and throughput. We can add several permanent disks onto the VM and configure at most 64 TB of storage space to every VM. The disk throughput of every VM can reach up to 80,000 (input/output operations) and 1600 MB/second, with a read delay of less than 1 millisecond. Premium Managed Disk is supported by the sizes of the DS Series, DSv2 Series and FS Series VMs exclusively used for Premium Disks.

Standard Managed Disk

Standard Managed Disks employ a hard disk drive (HDD)-based storage medium. They are most suitable for development/testing not sensitive to performance changes and other non-frequent access workloads.

The total cost of Standard Managed Disk storage depends on the disk’s size and quantity, transaction amount and outgoing data transmission. There is no difference between different Standard Disk sizes in IOPS and throughput.

FAQ

Expand all
  • If I add the empty 100GB disk onto my virtual machine, will I be charged the entire 100 GB expense or just the cost of the storage space I used?

    If the empty 100GB disk is supported by a Premium Storage account, you will be charged for a P10 (128GB) disk. If you use any other types of Storage account, only the storage space for storing data written into the disk will be charged, irrespective of the allocated disk size.

  • Does the Service Level Agreement cover Premium Storage, the same as other Storage services?

    Yes. 99.9% read/write availability also applies to Premium Storage accounts.

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support and select self-help service or any other method to contact us for support.

We guarantee that we can successfully process data reading requests from an offsite redundant storage (RA-GRS) account at least 99.99% of the time (99.9% for the Cold Access Layer), provided that we will retry in the secondary zone from the data writing failure from the primary zone.

We guarantee that we can successfully process data reading from local redundant storage (LRS) and offsite redundant storage (GRS) accounts at least 99.9% of the time (99% for the Cold Access Layer)

We guarantee that we can successfully process data writing requests into onsite redundant storage (LRS) and geo-redundant storage (GRS) accounts and read and access geo-redundant storage (RA-GRS) accounts at least 99.9% of the time (99% for the Cold Access Layer).

To learn more about the details of our Service Level Agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.

The Managed Disk itself doesn’t provide a Service Level Agreement with financial support. The availability of a Managed Disk depends on the Service Level Agreement governing the basic storage used and the Virtual Machine it’s attached to. To learn more about the details of the Service Level Agreement of the Managed Disk, please visit the Managed Disk Service Level Agreements page.
